Name front end keywords

Hover the field to get a tip

  • Object-fit

    The CSS _______ property is used to specify how an "img" or "'video'" should be resized to fit its container.

  • Flex-direction

    The _______ property defines in which direction the container wants to stack the flex items.

  • Box-sizing

    The CSS _______ property allows us to include the padding and border in an element's total width and height.

  • Flex-flow

    The _______ property is a shorthand property for setting both the flex-direction and flex-wrap properties.

  • grid-template-columns

    The _______ property defines the number of columns in your grid layout, and it can define the width of each column.

  • Justify-content

    Use the _______ property to align the grid inside the container

  • Align-content

    The _______ property is used to vertically align the whole grid inside the container.

  • clear

    The _______ property specifies what elements can float beside the cleared element and on which side.

  • overflow

    The _______ property specifies whether to clip the content or to add scrollbars when the content of an element is too big to fit in the specified area.

  • display flex

    The _______ Layout Module, makes it easier to design flexible responsive layout structure without using float or positioning.

  • resize

    The _______ property specifies if (and how) an element should be resizable by the user.

  • getFullYear()

    The _______ method returns the year of a date as a four digit number

  • objects

    _______ can contain many values.

  • innerHTML

    The easiest way to modify the content of an HTML element is by using the _______ property

  • this

    In an object method, _______ refers to the "owner" of the method.

  • break

    The _______ statement "jumps out" of a loop.

  • var()

    The _______ function can be used to insert the value of a custom property.

  • join()

    The _______ method also joins all array elements into a string.

  • pop()

    The _______ method removes the last element from an array:

  • map()

    The _______ method creates a new array by performing a function on each array element.
